title: How Meta built the infrastructure for Threads
subtitle: On July 5, 2023, Meta launched Threads, the newest product in our family of apps, to an unprecedented success that saw it garner over 100 million sign ups in its first five days.
author: Laine Campbell, Chunqiang (CQ) Tang

title: All Your Memories Are Stored by One Weird, Ancient Molecule
subtitle: We actually borrowed our ability to form memories from viruses.
author: Peter Hess

title: Kara Swisher on Tech Billionaires: “I Don’t Think They Like People”
subtitle: One of the most influential Silicon Valley reporters chronicles the rise of an industry, and moguls like Elon Musk, in “Burn Book.”
author: Kara Swisher and David Remnick

title: The 200 Best Albums of the 1980s
subtitle: Kate Bush, N.W.A., Brian Eno, Madonna, Prince, Bruce Springsteen, Sade, Sonic Youth, Janet Jackson, and the other icons who defined a decade
author: Pitchfork

title: The 25 Best Indie Pop Albums of the '90s
subtitle: While alternative rock raged in the 1990s, the softhearted sound of bands like Heavenly, Tiger Trap, and the Pastels welcomed listeners into their own secret world.
author: Pitchfork

title: Modern Art and the Esteem Machine
subtitle: Picasso was a joke. Then he was a god. How did his art finally take off in America?
author: Louis Menand

title: The Smell of Doughnuts
subtitle: I wandered in and out of bars, looking for someone or something to turn the night into an adventure, but all I found were a few more drinks.
author: Ottessa Moshfegh

title: Clubbing Is a Lifeline—and It’s Back
subtitle: After the coronavirus pandemic, New Yorkers will not take their dance-club scene for granted again.
author: Emily Witt

title: The Grocery Store Where Produce Meets Politics
subtitle: The legendary Park Slope Food Co-op carries sustainable food, low prices, and New Yorkers’ opinions in bulk.
author: Alexandra Schwartz

title: Looking for Gold at a Department of Finance Vehicle Auction
subtitle: At an impound lot in Gravesend, Brooklyn, bidders know that the car they nab for a song won’t come with a key. But will it have an engine?
author: Adam Iscoe

title: Among the A.I. Doomsayers
subtitle: Some people think machine intelligence will transform humanity for the better. Others fear it may destroy us. Who will decide our fate?
author: Andrew Marantz

title: When Your Law-School Homework Is Stranger Than Fiction
subtitle: RonNell Andersen Jones, a law professor at the University of Utah, can’t update the curriculum for her First Amendment seminar fast enough.
author: Andrew Marantz
